physical_appearance:This is a document listing a list of casualties. It is printed in black ink on a plain sheet of paper. The title is printed at the top of the document
 and underlined. There are several small folds on the document
 on the bottom-right corner
 and top right corner. There is a faint horizontal fold line across the center of the document.

sgcool_label_text:Loose papers from the James Steele
 P.O.W archive that include a symbolic drawing
 Japanese banana money
 map of camp
 administrative papers from Changi prison pre-dating internment
 list of soldiers of a regiment as well as James Steele’s warrant to  join the army. These papers are part of the archive of James Steele
 Royal Artillery (Field) who served in Malaya from January 1941-February 1942
 when interned as a P.O.W at Changi until his release in October 1945.

metadata.title_text: Miscellaneous scraps of paper from P.O.W James Steele Archives (30 pieces) P.O.W. James Steele Archives: List of casualties, Tamarkan Hospital Camp, Thailand
metadata.physical_appearance: This is a document listing a list of casualties. It is printed in black ink on a plain sheet of paper. The title is printed at the top of the document, and underlined. There are several small folds on the document, on the bottom-right corner, and top right corner. There is a faint horizontal fold line across the center of the document.
metadata.subject_terms_1: world wars prisoners of war documents (object genre) casualties hospital records
metadata.subject_terms_2: World War, 1939-1945 Prisoners of war Lists War casualties Hospitals
metadata.context_7: Great Britain. Army. Royal Field Artillery
metadata.sgcool_label_text: Loose papers from the James Steele, P.O.W archive that include a symbolic drawing, Japanese banana money, map of camp, administrative papers from Changi prison pre-dating internment, list of soldiers of a regiment as well as James Steele’s warrant to  join the army. These papers are part of the archive of James Steele, Royal Artillery (Field) who served in Malaya from January 1941-February 1942, when interned as a P.O.W at Changi until his release in October 1945.
